sen.j: 日本人形（にほんにんぎょう）とは、和服を着、日本髪を結った、日本の伝統的な風俗を写した人形の総称である。
sen.e: Japanese doll is the general term for dolls which have Japanese clothes and hairstyles and reflect traditional Japanese culture.
Japanese doll is the general term for dolls which have Japanese clothes and hairstyles and reflect traditional Japanese culture.
Japanese doll is the general term for dolls which have Japanese clothes and hairstyles and reflect traditional Japanese culture.

sen.j: 一般に日本人形という場合、「市松人形」や「衣裳人形」をさすことが多い。
sen.e: In general, the term Japanese doll frequently refers to Ichimatsu-ningyo dolls or Isho-ningyo (costume) dolls.
In general, the term Japanese doll frequently refers to Ichimatsu-ningyo dolls or Isho-ningyo (costume) dolls.
In general, the term Japanese doll frequently refers to 'Ichimatsu ningyo' dolls or 'Isho ningyo' (costume) dolls.

sen.j: 一般家庭等で置物として飾られる工芸品としての他、美術的価値の高い品もある。
sen.e: As well as craftworks for display in ordinary households, there are also dolls which are extremely valuable artworks.
As well as craftworks for display in ordinary households, there are also dolls which are extremely valuable artworks.
As well as craftworks for display in ordinary households, there are also dolls which are extremely valuable artworks.

sen.j: 1927年（昭和二年）にアメリカ合衆国に市松人形が人形大使として贈られた際に、「日本人形」の説明が付けられた。
sen.e: In 1927, when a batch of Ichimatsu dolls were sent to the USA as 'Ambassadors of Friendship', an explanation of Japanese dolls was attached.
In 1927, when a batch of Ichimatsu dolls were sent to the USA as 'Ambassadors of Friendship', an explanation of Japanese dolls was attached.
In 1927, when a batch of Ichimatsu dolls were sent to the USA as 'Ambassadors of Friendship', an explanation of Japanese dolls was attached.

sen.j: 概要
sen.e: Outline
Outline
Outline

sen.j: 衣裳人形は、江戸時代に武家の子女が嫁ぐ際に、婚礼の家財道具としても扱われる習わしがあり、人形にその災厄を身代りさせるという大切な役割もあった。
sen.e: There was a tradition of including Isho-ningyo costume dolls in the wedding trousseau of daughters of samurai in the Edo Period and the dolls played an important role in bearing the burdens or bad luck in place of the bride.

There was a tradition of including Isho-ningyo costume dolls in the wedding trousseau of daughters of samurai in the Edo Period and the dolls played an important role in bearing the burdens or bad luck in place of the bride.

There was a tradition of including Isho-ningyo costume dolls in the wedding trousseau of daughters of samurai in the Edo Period and the dolls played an important role in bearing the burdens or bad luck in place of the bride.

sen.j: 衣裳人形は、様々な衣裳で製作され、その姿から身分や職業がわけられる。
sen.e: Isho-ningyo dolls are made with a variety of costumes, which can be used to distinguish the identity and occupation of the doll.
Isho-ningyo dolls are made with a variety of costumes, which can be used to distinguish the identity and occupation of the doll.
Isho-ningyo dolls are made with a variety of costumes, which can be used to distinguish the position in society and occupation of the doll.

sen.j: 例をあげれば「舞妓」「藤娘」「町娘」「武家娘」「姫君」などがある。
sen.e: For example, apprentice geisha, wisteria maiden, town maiden, samurai daughter or noble lady.
For example, apprentice geisha, wisteria maiden, town maiden, samurai daughter or noble lady.
For example, 'apprentice geisha,' 'wisteria maiden,' 'town maiden,' 'samurai daughter' or 'noble lady'.

sen.j: 厄よけの身代りでもあることから、なるべく身分が高く姿の美しい人形が、婚礼道具として勧められる。
sen.e: As they were also meant to protect the bride from ill fortune, it was commended to furnish the wedding trousseau with the most grand and beautiful doll.
As they were also meant to protect the bride from ill fortune, it was commended to furnish the wedding trousseau with the most grand and beautiful doll.
As they were also meant to protect the bride from ill fortune, it was commended to furnish the wedding trousseau with the most grand and beautiful doll.

sen.j: このような人形を婚礼道具のひとつとした時代は近年まで続き、1980年代半ばまで多くみられた。
sen.e: The custom of giving these kinds of dolls as wedding furnishings was common until the middle of the 1980s.
The custom of giving these kinds of dolls as wedding furnishings was common until the middle of the 1980s.
The custom of giving these kinds of dolls as wedding furnishings was common until the middle of the 1980s.

sen.j: 日本人形のなかでも、節句人形は伝統的にその手や足、頭（顔）、髪結い、衣裳の仕立てなどそれぞれを専門に製作を受け持つ人形工芸師が分業している。
sen.e: Even among Japanese dolls, traditionally the hands and feet, faces, hairdos and costumes of the dolls for the Girls Day and Boy's Day Festivals are each made by a craftsman who specialize in that part of the doll.

Even among Japanese dolls, traditionally the hands and feet, faces, hairdos and costumes of the dolls for the Girls Day and Boy's Day Festivals are each made by a craftsman who specialize in that part of the doll.

Even among Japanese dolls, traditionally the hands and feet, faces, hairdos and costumes of the dolls for the Girls Day and Boy's Day Festivals are each made by a craftsman who specialize in that part of the doll.

sen.j: 製作において人形は順番に人形工芸師の手によって組み立てられる。
sen.e: The doll parts are assembled in order by the doll maker.
The doll parts are assembled in order by the doll maker.
The doll parts are assembled in order by the doll maker.

sen.j: そして、最終的に衣裳の着物を着付ける人形着付け師のもとで、完成まで仕上げられる。
sen.e: Then finally a craftsperson who specializes in putting the costumes on the dolls finishes off the doll with the costume.
Then finally a craftsperson who specializes in putting the costumes on the dolls finishes off the doll with the costume.
Then finally a craftsperson who specializes in putting the costumes on the dolls finishes off the doll with the costume.

sen.j: 一般によくいわれる、有職人形はこのような製作手順がとられている。
sen.e: The commonly called yushoku ningyo (artisan dolls) are made by this method.
sen.cmt: 有職 artisan dollsにしました。
sen.e: The commonly called yushoku ningyo (artisan dolls) are made by this method.
The commonly called yusoku ningyo (noble dolls) are made by this method.

sen.j: 主に京都、東京で製作される。
sen.e: They are mainly made in Kyoto and Tokyo.
They are mainly made in Kyoto and Tokyo.
They are mainly made in Kyoto and Tokyo.

sen.j: おやま人形
sen.e: Oyama-ningyo
Oyama-ningyo
Oyama ningyo

sen.j: 女性型の衣装着人形の総称。
sen.e: A general term for dolls with female costumes.
A general term for dolls with female costumes.
A general term for dolls with female costumes.

sen.j: 藤娘や汐汲などの日本舞踊の衣装を着ていることが多い。
sen.e: They are often dressed with Japanese dance costumes such as the wisteria maiden or shiokumi doll (doll carrying sea water to make salt).
They are often dressed with Japanese dance costumes such as the wisteria maiden or shiokumi doll (doll carrying sea water to make salt).
They are often dressed with Japanese dance costumes such as the wisteria maiden or shiokumi doll (doll carrying sea water to make salt).

sen.j: 人形師の小山次郎三郎にちなんでおやま人形と呼ばれる。
sen.e: They are called Oyama dolls after the doll maker Jiro Saburo Oyama.
They are called Oyama dolls after the doll maker Jiro Saburo Oyama.
They are called Oyama dolls after the doll maker Jiro Saburo Oyama.

sen.j: 製法は衣裳人形に準ずる。
sen.e: The method of manufacture is the same as for Isho-ningyo (costume dolls).
The method of manufacture is the same as for Isho-ningyo (costume dolls).
The method of manufacture is the same as for Isho-ningyo (costume dolls).

sen.j: 風俗人形（ふうぞくにんぎょう）
sen.e: Fuzoku-ningyo
Fuzoku-ningyo
Fuzoku ningyo

sen.j: やまと人形
sen.e: Yamato-ningyo
Yamato-ningyo
Yamato ningyo

sen.j: 市松人形、東人形、京人形 (人形)などの総称。
sen.e: A general term for Ichimatsu-ningyo, Higashi-ningyo(Tokyo dolls), and Kyo-ningyo (Kyoto dolls).
sen.cmt: 東人形higashi-ningyo にしました。
sen.e: A general term for Ichimatsu-ningyo, Higashi-ningyo(Tokyo dolls), and Kyo-ningyo (Kyoto dolls).
A general term for Ichimatsu ningyo, Azuma ningyo (Azuma [eastern] dolls), and Kyo ningyo (Kyoto dolls).

sen.j: 各地でめいめいに呼ばれていたため、1933年（昭和8年）吉徳十世山田徳兵衛が中心となり、総じて「やまと人形」の呼称が考えだされた。
sen.e: As the dolls were called different names in different regions around Japan, in 1933 Tokube Yamada X (Yoshitoku) originated the general term 'Yamato Ningyo'.
As the dolls were called different names in different regions around Japan, in 1933 Tokube Yamada X (Yoshitoku) originated the general term 'Yamato Ningyo'.
As the dolls were called different names in different regions around Japan, in 1933 Tokubei YAMADA (Yoshitoku X) originated the general term 'Yamato Ningyo'.

sen.j: 頭と手足は桐塑、胴はおがくずを詰め込んだ布で出来た玩具の着せ替え人形で、人形のみでの状態で売られ、着物や衣装は購入者が作成する。
sen.e: It is a dress-up doll with head, arms and legs made of a type of wood composition called toso (from the paulownia tree), and trunk made with cloth stuffed with sawdust, and they were sold without costumes as the customer made their own kimono or costumes for the dolls.

It is a dress-up doll with head, arms and legs made of a type of wood composition called toso (from the paulownia tree), and trunk made with cloth stuffed with sawdust, and they were sold without costumes as the customer made their own kimono or costumes for the dolls.

It is a dress-up doll with head, arms and legs made of a type of wood composition called toso (from the paulownia tree), and trunk made with cloth stuffed with sawdust, and they were sold without costumes as the customer made their own kimono or costumes for the dolls.

sen.j: 女児の遊び道具のほか、和裁の裁縫の練習台としても使用された。
sen.e: As well as being a toy for girls, they were also used as models for practicing the sewing of Japanese clothes.
As well as being a toy for girls, they were also used as models for practicing the sewing of Japanese clothes.
As well as being a toy for girls, they were also used as models for practicing the sewing of Japanese clothes.

sen.j: 御所人形（ごしょにんぎょう）
sen.e: Gosho-ningyo (Imperial palace dolls)
Gosho-ningyo (Imperial palace dolls)
Gosho ningyo (Imperial palace dolls)

sen.j: おもに男児の赤子、帝をかたどった土製、桐塑製の人形。
sen.e: Mostly baby boy dolls or Imperial Palace dolls made of clay or toso(type of wood composition).
Mostly baby boy dolls or Imperial Palace dolls made of clay or toso(type of wood composition).
Mostly baby boy dolls or Imperial Palace dolls made of clay or toso(type of wood composition).

sen.j: 江戸時代には、その見た目より白菊人形、頭大人形、人形問屋の名前より伊豆蔵人形とも呼ばれてた。
sen.e: Due to their looks, in the Edo Period they were also called shiragiku-ningyo (white chrysanthemum dolls), zudai-ningyo (large headed dolls) or Izukura-ningyo after a doll dealer.
Due to their looks, in the Edo Period they were also called shiragiku-ningyo (white chrysanthemum dolls), zudai-ningyo (large headed dolls) or Izukura-ningyo after a doll dealer.
Due to their looks, in the Edo Period they were also called shiragiku ningyo (white chrysanthemum dolls), zudai ningyo (large headed dolls) or Izukura ningyo after a doll dealer.

sen.j: 御所人形と称されたのは明治時代以降のことである。
sen.e: The term Gosho-ningyo came into use after the Meiji Period.
The term Gosho-ningyo came into use after the Meiji Period.
The term Gosho ningyo came into use after the Meiji Period.

sen.j: 参勤交代時の西国大名が朝廷、公家より贈答され国許へのお土産としても使われた。
sen.e: During the time of the sankin-kotai system in the Edo period, in which feudal lords were obligated to live in Edo each alternate year, daimyo (feudal lords) from western Japan, the Gosho dolls were given as gifts by the Imperial court and used as souvenirs when the feudal lords returned home.

During the time of the sankin-kotai system in the Edo period, in which feudal lords were obligated to live in Edo each alternate year, daimyo (feudal lords) from western Japan, the Gosho dolls were given as gifts by the Imperial court and used as souvenirs when the feudal lords returned home.

sen.j: 木の板の上に御所人形と造花、毛植人形などを取り付け、能の舞台や吉祥物などを表現した人形。
sen.e: Dolls with a Gosho doll standing on a wooden dais with flowers or animals, and representing the Noh stage or lucky charms.

sen.j: 皇族の子女の誕生や初節句のお祝いなどに皇室や上流階級で贈答された。
sen.e: Nobles and aristocracy presented princesses with gifts of these dolls for birthdays and seasonal festivals.

sen.j: 各地の人形については、記事郷土人形も参照のこと。
